notes.note: A 4-credit option is offered for the Writing in the Majors component of this course. A max of 4 credits is offered for this course.

course.subject: LING
course.course_title: History of the English Language to 1300

notes.note: Prerequisite: 1 year prior Sanskrit study or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 1101 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisites: a 2000-level (or higher) course in any Romance language and some familiarity with a second one or with Latin.
Prerequisite: LING 3302 or equivalent. Discussion: TBA
Prerequisite: LING 3303 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 3302 or permission of instructor.
Recommended: previous course work in linguistics or programming.
Basic familiarity with the forms of classical Greek.
Prerequisite: submission of honors thesis application and meet with the Director of Undergraduate Studies.

course.subject: LING
course.course_title: Topics in the Philosophy of Language

notes.note: Prerequisite: LING 4401 and LING 4403 or permission of instructor.
Requirement for third-year linguistics graduate students. Participants must enroll in a concurrent independent study with a special committee member, or a relevant workshop.
Prerequisite: LING 4404 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 4436 or equivalent or permission of instructor.

course.subject: LING
course.course_title: Topics in the Philosophy of Language

notes.note: Prerequisite: knowledge of Slavic or ancient Indo-European language.
